accountage.description: Shows when and how long ago a user created their twitch account.

usage.description: Defaults to the executor if no user is provided.
Get the account age of a user.

add.description: Adds one or more 7TV emotes. This searches for the provided emote(s) and adds the first exact match.

usage.description: Add 7TV emotes by searching for them. Emote ids or urls can also be provided.
Using the 'as' flag will add an emote as an alias.
Using the 'from' flag will add 7TV emotes that are added in the specified channel. This is case sensitive.
Using the 'in' flag will add 7TV emotes from the current channel in the specified channel. This searches for emotes if they were not found in the current channel.

flags.description: Add an emote as an alias.
Add emotes from a channel, this is case sensitive.
Add emotes in a different channel.

afk.description: Sets an AFK status, and sends a message when you're back.

usage.description: Go AFK without a status.
Go AFK with a status.
Using the 'brb' or 'gn' alias will send a more fitting message.

always.description: Allows one or more commands to still be useable while the channel is live.

usage.description: Allow one or more commands. This will also enable all of the command's aliases while live.
Allow all commands.

asay.description: Sends a message through a different user.

usage.description: Send a message.
Using the 'in' flag will send the message in the specified channel.

flags.description: The channel to send the message to.

ascii.description: Makes an ascii art of a Twitch, 7TV, BTTV or FFZ emote. This uses the first frame if the emote is animated.

usage.description: Make an ascii art.
Using the 'in' alias will use emotes from the specified channel.

flags.description: Looks for emotes in the provided channel.

b64.description: Encodes/decodes text to or from base64.

usage.description: Encode text to base64.
usage.example: encode Base64 is not a form of encryption!

usage.description: Decode bas64 to text.

ban.description: Bans a user from interacting in any way with the bot in the current channel.

usage.description: Ban a user.

banphrase.description: Adds a banphrase. This will ban a first time chatter if any part of it is in their message.

usage.description: Show all banphrases.
Add a banphrase.
Remove a banphrase.
Enclosing the banphrase with slashes '/' will add the banphrase as a regex pattern. This is still not case sensitive.
Enable all banphrases.
Disable all banphrases.
Get your own about me.
Get a user's about me.

cat.description: Collects the fish your cat has caught. It catches 1 cat every 30 minutes.

usage.description: Collect your fish.

cdata.description: Gets an estimated chance for each cookie based on logs for ThePositiveBot, this is not updated in real time.

usage.description: Get the data.

chatsettings.description: Gets the chat settings and modes in a channel.

usage.description: Defaults to the current channel if no channel is provded.
Get the settings in a channel.

flags.description: Gets the chatsettings in the provided channel.

choice.description: Picks a random option from the provided options.

usage.description: Pick a random option. Options must be seperated by a space.
Flip a coin. Will land on either heads or tails.

command.description: Manages custom commands for the current channel.

usage.description: Commands can be added or selected with regex by enclosing the trigger with slashes '/'. They can also be selected by using the id. These should always be provided right after the subcommand.
Add a custom command. Commands using a regex pattern as trigger are not case sensitive by default.
There are a few variables that can be added to the response. See the full variable list at the bottom.
Get the response and settings of a command.
Edit the response of a command.
Change the trigger of a command.
Add or remove aliases for a command. If a message starts with an alias, the command will also get triggered. This does not support regex.
usage.example: alias id:1234 add hello hi hey
alias id:1234 remove hello hi hey

usage.description: Add or remove keywords for a command. If a keyword is in any part of a message (seperated by a non-word character), the command will also get triggered. This does not support regex.
usage.example: keyword id:1234 add hello hi hey
keyword id:1234 remove hello hi hey

usage.description: Change the settings for a command. Multiple options can be changed in a single message. The available settings are:
Enable a command.
Disable a command.
Toggle case case sensitivity for a command trigger.
Set a channel cooldown for a command in seconds.
Set a user cooldown for a command in seconds.
Set a role requirement for a command. A user requires at least this role or higher to execute the command. Valid roles are: blacklisted, regular, subscriber, vip, moderator, broadcaster.
Delete a command.

commands.description: Gets a list of all the custom command triggers and their id's in the current channel.

usage.description: Get the custom command list.

disable.description: Disables a command in the current channel.

usage.description: Disable one or more commands.
Disable all commands.

editorfor.description: Gets the channels a user is editor in and if the request is still pending.

usage.description: Get the channels you are editor in.
Get the channels someone else is editor in.

emote.description: Gets basic information about a 7tv emote.

usage.description: Get information about an added emote.
Get information from an emote url or id.
Using the 'in' alias will look for the emote name in a different channel. This does not work when a url or id is provided.

flags.description: Looks for emotes in the provided channel.

emotelink.description: Gets a 7tv cdn link for an emote from the current channel.

usage.description: Get a cdn link.
Get the cdn link for the specified file extension or size.
Using the 'in' flag will look for the emote in a different channel.

flags.description: Looks for emotes in the provided channel.

emotes.description: Gets all 7tv emotes added in the current channel. The bot requires at least vip to use this command.

usage.description: Get all the emotes.
Get all the emotes from a different channel.
Get all added emotes uploaded by the specified twitch user.
Get all added emotes with the specified id or url.

flags.description: Gets the emotes from the provided channel channel.
Filters emotes to only show emotes by the provided uploader based on their twitch username.
Filters emotes to only show emotes with the provided id.

enable.description: Enables a command in the current channel.

usage.description: Enable one or more commands.
Enable all commands.

epoch.description: Gets the date and time for the specified unix timestamp.

usage.description: Get the current unix time.
Get the date and time for a specified timestamp. If the length of the timestamp is longer than 10, it will use miliseconds, else it will defualt to seconds.
Fish.
Get your followage in the current channel.
Get a different users followage in the current channel.
Get a different users followage in a different channel.
Using the 'in' flag will get your followage in the specified channel.

flags.description: Gets a user's followage in the provided channel.

fullunscramble.description: Gets all words that can be made using the provided letters.

usage.description: Unscramble the letters.
Using the 'min' or 'max' flag will cap the length of words.

flags.description: Sets the minimun word length to the provided length.
Sets the maximum word length at the provided length.

haspotat.description: Gets PotatBotat data for a channel.

usage.description: Get data for the current channel.
Get data for a different channel. Using the 'in' flag has the same effect.

flags.description: Gets the data from the specified channel.

help.description: Gets help on how to use a command.

usage.description: Get a link where all commands are listed.
Get help a specific command.

hint.description: Gets a hint for the active trivia in the current channel.

usage.description: Get a hint.

ic.description: Returns the combining grapheme joiner, which is an invisible character that can be sent on twitch.

usage.description: Get the character.

join.description: Joins the bot in your channel.

usage.description: Join the bot.

leaderboard.description: Gets the leaderboard for fish or catfood.

usage.description: Get the fish leaderboard.
Get the catfood leaderboard.
Get your own level.
Get a different user's level.
Using the 'mainlist' alias will use your list called 'main'. You will have this list by default.
Using the 'lists' alias will show all your lists.
Create a list.
Get the items in a list.
Add an item to a list.
Show an item from a list using its index.
Remove an item from a list using its index.
Delete a list.
Restore a list, if no new list with that name has been created.

morse.description: Encodes/decodes morse code, decode needs to be the same format as encode returns.

usage.description: Encode text.
usage.example: encode I like dots and dashes!

usage.description: Decode text.

namechange.description: Gets the name history of a user.

usage.description: Get your own name changes.
Get a different user's name changes.
Using the 'dates' flag will provide the date each name change was detected.

flags.description: Also provides the dates for each name change.

offlineonly.description: Disables a command while the current channel is live.

usage.description: Disable one or more commands while live.
Disable all commands while live.

part.description: Parts the bot from your channel.

usage.description: Part the bot.

ping.description: Gets basic information about the bot.

usage.description: Get the information.

player.description: Gets the twitch player for a channel.

usage.description: Defaults to the current channel if no channel is provided.
Get a channel's player. Using the 'in' flag has the same effect.
Using the 'muted' flag will mute the player.
Using the 'extensions' flag will enable extensions (such as blerp) on the stream.
Using the 'pause' flag will stop the player from auto-playing.

flags.description: Gets the player for the specified channel.
Mutes the streams audio.
Enables extensions from showing on the stream.
Stops the stream from auto-playing.

usage.description: Execute the ask command with a prompt.
Execute the gpt command with a prompt.

potatocooldowns.description: Gets the cooldowns for the potato farming commands on PotatBotat for a user.

usage.description: Get your own cooldowns.
Get a user's cooldowns.

potatoinfo.description: Gets PotatBotat farming stats that can only be seen through api.

usage.description: Get your own stats.
Get a user's stats.

presence.description: Updates a user's 7tv cosmetics for everyone with the current chat open.

usage.description: Update your cosmetics.
Update a user's cosmetics.
Using the 'in' flag will update cosmetics for users in the specified channel.

flags.description: Updates a user's presence in the specified channel.

prestige.description: Makes you prestige in the minigame. This gives a 10% catfood multiplier.

usage.description: Prestige.
Pull and restart the bot.
Using the 'restart' alias will restart the bot.
Using the 'pip' flag will install all packages before restarting.

flags.description: Install all packages from requirements.txt.

usage.description: Execute code.

pyramid.description: spams a word or sentence in a pyramid. The max width is currently 5.

usage.description: Make a pyramid.

quiz.description: Gets the answer for a PotatBotat quiz. Tip: replying to the quiz message will also work!

usage.description: Get the answer.
usage.example: If 3 potatoes cost $1.50, how much do 8 potatoes cost?

raidmessage.description: Add/remove a raid message that will be sent when the channel gets raided.

usage.description: Set a raid message.
Variables can be added to the message for more information.
'username': The channel that raided the current channel. This is all lowercase.
usage.example: set ${username} just raided the channel, check them out at twitch.tv/${username}!

usage.description: 'display': The display name for the channel that raided the current channel. This will also work for localized display names.
'viewers': The amount of raiders.
Remove a raid message.

rank.description: Shows information about your current minigame rank.

usage.description: Show information.

rankup.description: Ranks you up to the next minigame rank.

usage.description: Rank up.
Reload all commands.
Reload one or more commands.
Remove one or more emotes.
An id or url can also be provided. This will remove all emotes with the specified id.
Using the 'in' flag will remove emotes in the specified channel.

flags.description: Remove emotes in a different channel.

usage.description: Rename a 7tv emote. Using the 'as' flag as the same effect as providing a new alias.
Using the 'in' alias will rename the emote in the specified channel.

flags.description: Rename emotes in a different channel.
The alias to rename the emote to.

reply.description: Sets the way the bot will reply to your messages. This is set to 'reply' by default

usage.description: Set the way the bot replies to you, there are 4 different options, which are listed below.
reply: Replies to your messages.
ping: Mentions you at the start of the message.
unping: Mentions you at the start of the message, but without actually pinging you.
none: Wont ping you at all.
Send a message.
Using the 'in' flag will send the message in the provided channel.
Using the 'api' flag will send the message through helix instead of tmi.

flags.description: The channel to send the message to.
Send the message through helix instead of irc.

usage.description: Scramble a sentence.

sell.description: Sells your fish for cat food.

usage.description: Sell your fish. A percentage or 'all' can be provided.

sellprice.description: Gets the current sellprice. This changes every 15 minutes.

usage.description: Get the current sellprice.

setlevel.description: Sets a user's global bot level.

usage.description: Set a user's level.
See the shop.

spam.description: Spam a message. Max spam count is 10.

usage.description: Spam a message.
Execute a query.

stats.description: Gets minigame stats for a user.

usage.description: Get stats for a user.

streaminfo.description: Gets stream information for a channel.

usage.description: Get stream information for a channel. Using the 'in' flag will have the same effect.

flags.description: The channel to get the stream information from.

stvsa.description: Shows how long a user has been a 7tv sub, or when they were last subbed.

usage.description: Get a user's 7tv subage.

stvset.description: Gets the the active set in a channel.

usage.description: Get the active set in the provided channel. Using the 'in' flag will have the same effect.

flags.description: The channel to get the set of.

usage.description: Get a 7tv user by twitch username, twitch id or 7tv id.
Using the 'query' flag will get the first user for the provided query.
Using the 'discord' flag will get the user with the provided discord id.
Using the 'kick' flag will get the user with the provided kick username.

flags.description: Get the first user from user search.
Get a user by their discord id.
Get a user by their kick slug (username).

subage.description: Shows how long a user has been subbed to a channel, or when they were last subbed.

usage.description: Get a user's subage for the current channel.
Get a user's subage in channel.

flags.description: Get a user's sub age in a different channel.

suggest.description: Makes a suggestion or bug report. Or checks a suggestion's status by it's id.

usage.description: Make a suggestion or bug report.
usage.example: this and that is not working

usage.description: Check a suggestion's status.

time.description: Gets the date and time for a timezone.

usage.description: Get the date for a timezone, country or country code.

title.description: Gets the title of a channel. Defaults to the current channel.

usage.description: Get the title for the current channel.
Get the title for a channel. Using the 'in' alias has the same effect.

flags.description: The channel to get the title of.

trigger.description: Sets a custom bot trigger for the current channel.

usage.description: Set the bot trigger.

trivia.description: Starts a trivia with a random trivia question which has to be answered in chat.

usage.description: Start a trivia.
Using the 'category' flag will only start trivias with the specified category.
Using the 'difficulty' flag will only start trivias with the specified difficulty. This can also be achieved by using the 'easy', 'medium' or 'hard' flags.

flags.description: The trivia category to get the trivia of.
The trivia difficulty to get the trivia of.
Only get easy trivias.
Only get medium trivias.
Only get hard trivias.

uid.description: Gets the stored ids for a user.

usage.description: Get your own stored ids.
Get a user's stored ids.

unban.description: Unban a user from the bot in the current channel.

usage.description: Unban a user.
Unscramble letters.
Get your own twitch user.
Get a twitch user.

usercard.description: Get the usercard link for a user in a channel

usage.description: Get your usercard for the current channel.
Get a user's usercard for the current channel.
Get a user's usercard for the specified channel.

flags.description: The channel to get the usercard in.

usertime.description: Gets the current time for the provided user. Also sets your timezone so others can get your time.

usage.description: Get your current time.
Get a user's current time.
Set your own timezone. This can be a timezone, country or country code

vanish.description: Vanish from the chat. This will time you out for 1 second.

usage.description: Vanish.
